2017 WW12 Purley Crystal Ridge BKC Release Announcement (BKC #2)

\n \n \n

DEG Platform Integration Team

\n \n
\n

The DEG platform Integration team announces the release of 2017 WW12 Purley Crystal Ridge BKC release package for Intel internal use. The release is based on OS of\n \n Fedora24\n server. The auto-installer packages are available in the Artifactory server (both SH site and OR site). Any questions please contact Bei, Ling.

\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
Auto InstallerSH Artifactory ServerOR Artifactory Server
Fedora24WithoutOS_BKC-CrystalRidge_FC24_55.116324.116243-2017WW12.zip\n \n
FC24x86_64.zip\n 		WithoutOS_BKC-CrystalRidge_FC24_55.116324.116243-2017WW12.zip\n \n
FC24x86_64.zip\n
\n

*Note: Please select the server which is closer to your region to get the better data accessing/downloading performance

\n
\n\n
\n
\n   Summary \n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n \n \n \n \n \n \n
\n

 

Test\nResult:

\xc2\xb7  Finish AEP test execution on Fedora24 (kernel\nis upgraded to 4.9.13 ) on 2-2-2 config (1LM + AppDirect). Please visit HPQC for test detail

\xc2\xb7 Refer to the installation guide BKC\npackage installation

\xc2\xb7 Total test case: 21; Passed test case is: 12 and pass\nrate is 57%

\xc2\xb7 STOP OS warm reset tests until further notice

   A\ncritical CR FW issue is found that could cause large write counts on warm reset\nand damage the media.

 

Mandatory BIOS knobs

\xc2\xb7        AttemptFastBoot=0x0

\xe2\x80\xa2        AttemptFastBootCold=0x0

\xe2\x80\xa2        PackageCState=0x0

\xe2\x80\xa2        SrefProgramming=0x1

\xe2\x80\xa2        OppSrefEn=0x0

\xe2\x80\xa2        DdrtSrefEn=0x0

\xe2\x80\xa2        CkeProgramming=0x1

\xe2\x80\xa2        PpdEn=0x0

\xe2\x80\xa2        DdrtCkeEn=0x0

\xe2\x80\xa2        DirectoryModeEn=0x0

\xe2\x80\xa2        promoteMrcWarnings=0x0

\xe2\x80\xa2        promoteWarnings=0x0                   

\xe2\x80\xa2        haltOnMemErr=0x0

\xe2\x80\xa2       DdrFreqLimit=0xD

 

ES1 AEP DIMM Setup BKM 

\xc2\xb7        Update CR FW

If AEP DIMM is not\nhealthy, use ITP/Jtag to update AEP FW and Syn SPD one by one, follow the BKM Setup_TAB_AEP_BKM_v1.1.docx

If AEP DIMM is\nhealth, use either ITP/Jtag or UEFI shell to update all AEP FW

               ApachePassCli.efi\nload \xe2\x80\x93f -source <path_to_strip.bin> - dimm

 \xc2\xb7     Goal/namespace can\nbe created under UEFI or Linux

a.          UEFI:\nApachePassCli.efi create -f -goal PersistentMemoryType=AppDirect

                 ApachePassCli.efi\nshow -a \xe2\x80\x93pool

                 ApachePassCli.efi\ncreate \xe2\x80\x93namespace \xe2\x80\x93pool <pool_Id> Type=AppDirect

b.          Linux: ixpdimm-cli\ncreate \xe2\x80\x93f \xe2\x80\x93goal persistentmemorytype=appdirect

                   ixpdimm- cli show -a\n\xe2\x80\x93pool

\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n

                   ixpdimm-cli create\n\xe2\x80\x93namespace \xe2\x80\x93pool <pool_Id> Type=AppDirect

\n   HW Rework \n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n \n \n \n \n
\n

Pedigree and Board Jumper Settings: 2S Guide

Note: Only mandatory and necessary optional rework is implemented by BKC team

\xc2\xb7      2s

o NC_RWK_I (Mandatory): Update BMC FW

o NC_RWK_K (Mandatory): Avoiding false LAN Wake Activations

o NC_RWK_L (Mandatory): Update CPLD FW

o NC_RWK_M (Mandatory): No-Boot without ITP issue fix

o Note: In case you have implemented Optional rework 20, you should move switch S4E2.4 to OFF position, otherwise the default position is ON.

InformationQuick Guide
BKC Artifactory Access

Link (SH server): https://ubit-artifactory-sh.intel.com

Link (OR server): https://ubit-artifactory-or.intel.com

Steps for applying the permission:

  • Go to EAM website: https://eam.intel.com/EAMWeb/RequestAccess/DisplayTree.aspx?TopNode=757719
  • Apply for the "Project viewer" role
  • Use your windows credentials for authentication

BKC One Stop Shop

Link: https://dcg-oss.intel.com/homepage_view/24/

Steps for applying the permission:

  • Go to EAM website: https://eam.intel.com/EAMWeb/RequestAccess/DisplayTree.aspx?TopNode=829001
  • Navigate to:"BKC -- Purley"
  • Apply for the "User" or "Ingredient Owner" role
  • Use your windows credentials for authentication

Contact Person: Bei, Ling
